message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.DS 

This paper deals with the problem of automated analysis of recursive derivations in logic programming, which is a core topic in programming languages and logic. The paper introduces a notion of observational productivity for logic programming and offers an implemented automated observational productivity checker for logic programs. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.PL (Programming Languages). The paper also deals with termination and non-termination, which are topics in formal methods and logic, making cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) another likely sub-category. The paper also presents an effective procedure for semi-deciding observational productivity, which involves algorithmic techniques and software engineering, making cs.SE (Software Engineering) a possible sub-category. The paper also deals with the distinction between inductive and coinductive programs, which is a topic in formal methods and type theory, making cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper presents an automated checker for logic programs, which involves algorithms and data structures, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category.
